# Markdown - All Basic Syntax Output

This is a minimal example of using **knitr** to produce an _HTML_ page from _Markdown_.

## Syntax Examples 

Plain text

End a line with two spaces to start a new paragraph.

*italics* and _italics_

**bold** and __bold__

superscript^2^

~~strikethrough~~

[link](www.rstudio.com) 

# Header 1
## Header 2
### Header 3
#### Header 4
##### Header 5
###### Header 6

endash: --

emdash: ---

ellipsis: ...

inline equation: $A = \pi*r^{2}$

image: 

![path-to-image](https://images.pexels.com/photos/92904/pexels-photo-92904.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&h=400&w=600)

horizontal rule (or slide break):

***

> block quote

* unordered list
* item 2
 + sub-item 1
 + sub-item 2

1. ordered list
2. item 2
 + sub-item 1
 + sub-item 2
 

## Conclusion

Markdown is super easy to write. 

1. View all the basic markdown syntax options at [HTML markdown guide](https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/)
2. View the **RMarkdown** [Cheatsheet](https://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/rmarkdown-cheatsheet.pdf) for more details.
